tweets.text:
Join our webinar next Wednesday (30th Sept) at 1pm and hear what Lucy Barker (@UK_CEH) has to say about Historic Droughts! 

Register free here:  

https://t.co/G5muNYJRRV

@ICE_engineers @EnvAgency @metoffice https://t.co/CcDE5IwYWJ

@CGOEcology @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @Feargal_Sharkey @SuttonCouncil @theriverstrust @PondRiverStream You should have seen it 40 years ago when it was heavily polluted before clean ups, closure of old industries & de-culverting in #Wandle Park - I was the very busy river pollution inspector for it back then

The River Wandle in Beddington, Croydon, South London/Greater London. Look how crystal clear it is!
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @Feargal_Sharkey @SuttonCouncil @theriverstrust @PondRiverStream https://t.co/m4YLGileaL

@VerValleySoc AND THEN! In 2021 we have a third surface run off, all within 30m, how can this be?? @ChrisWhite_SADC who approves something so intrusive, crude and ugly in full view? 20m from a brand new giant notice board, due to show off the plans to rejuvenate the river, ....what a start 😖 https://t.co/JhFy7S1fzR

Today we let the water through our first completed #FishPassage the RiverSevern 🙌 #LetItFlow #FishPassage @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup https://t.co/DvPy25LSuh

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgencyMids Agree this is difficult but surely the @EnvAgencyMids could request planning conditions around disposal of waste. Current planning application makes clear doubling Intensive Poultry Unit size yet waste might run off into local stream brook.

Found some #Aire white clawed #crayfish today.... but unfortunately all were dead. Not plague. 
Thanks @EnvAgencyYNE for quick, efficient response. 
Upper Aire Project #UAP site improving instream & riparian habitat to benefit these natives as well as trout et al @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/JqdDZON6tE

@GeorgeMonbiot @kilnerevonnet And @connectNLWA discharged 20x permitted mercury to water from the Edmonton incinerator in 2019 👇 No fines, no prosecution @EnvAgency @StopTheRebuild @XREnfield @XRLondon @xr_rebelradio https://t.co/zaLfe4UJX1

Today we let the water through our first completed #FishPassage the RiverSevern 🙌 #LetItFlow #FishPassage @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup https://t.co/M5LzxjUZNu

Hi @EnvAgency & @thameswater strong sewage smell today from this sinister outfall on north bank of Yeading Brook at Ruislip Gardens. This stretch has been popular with kingfishers recently. River looking a bit milky🤢. 3 word location: “empty people then”. FYI @FriendsRivCrane https://t.co/aUPBD7Pvzp

1/1 A crane will start removing the worst damaged boats on Monday Sep 28 and will begin to lift the remaining boats out of the water for inspection from Wednesday Sep 30. The crane will be based at Weston Lock. https://t.co/0XRoqxmCn8
Sewage at Mill Stream #Addingham today and sewage rags in tree. @YorkshireWater @YWHelp @EnvAgency https://t.co/9HwwjRDlaZ

@wildlifetoursuk @EnvAgencyYNE @WildTroutTrust @aireriverstrust @PeteTurnerEA @ilkleyIain @YorksWildlife Several dead newts, a few dead minnow and the state of the substrate (see pic 3) point to nutrient associated issues.
Plenty of live minnow & stone loach, fewer bullhead, v few trout & a lone brook lamprey.... Should be heaving with life up here in the tribs.

This should be headline news - it's an appalling indictment of @EnvAgency and regional water authorities. Are we really really longer shocked by such environmental decay and reduction in biodiversity? https://t.co/YzzFMSYGTk?

urls.title: Shocking state of English rivers revealed as all of them fail pollution tests
urls.description: Data reveals just 14% of good ecological standard and none of good chemical standard

tweets.text: Start up meeting today at #Sunbury Depot for #Wilson Boat yard project which starts on Monday 28th September #safe distancing adhered to .⁦@EnvAgencySE⁩ ⁦@MarkHill03⁩ ⁦@sarahchareEA⁩ ⁦@wifo_ea⁩ ⁦@TobyWillisonEA⁩ https://t.co/2LY1X0pp5D

@CleanIlkley @YorkshireWater @YWHelp @gregwrightYP @JayMitchinson YPN readers should be aware that @yorkshirewater dumped raw sewage in Yorkhire’s rivers on 22,000 separate occasions in 2019. Rules permit this in exceptional rainfall only. Nothing seems to change in 2020 and the @EnvAgency  lets it happen

@CleanIlkley @YorkshireWater @YWHelp That will be the same @YorkshireWater that dumped raw sewage into Yorkshire’s rivers on 22,000 separate occasions in 2019, or 60 times a day. This is only permitted during exceptional rainfall. It doesn’t rain that much - even in Yorkshire. @EnvAgency did naff all about it

Ever wondered where the fees from your fishing licences go?

These fees help us carry out important work protecting and improving fisheries throughout England. 

Find out more in our Facebook Note:
https://t.co/PwF0HlxT9I
#Angling #Fishing #GetFishing https://t.co/hEmtDRCIrv

tweets.text: Here's @DaveThroupEA explaining what a big moment this is for our project, for all our partners @EnvAgency,@severnrivers @CanalRiverTrust @NaturalEngland for #TwaiteShad and for all fish on the #RiverSevern 🐟🐟🐟 #FishPassage #FollowTheShad @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW https://t.co/GFndvLcELB

We’ve completed work at #MalinBridge in #Sheffield removing gravel and debris after winter.

It’s been done sensitively & we only removed debris above water level, this reduces flood risk but keeps good habitat for fish and biodiversity (the Heron seemed happy with the results) https://t.co/s2c9v8UxyC
@AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE Glad to hear the gravels were retained in the system!

@EdwinBeatnik @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @severnrivers @CanalRiverTrust @NaturalEngland @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW Allows fish swimming upstream such as endangered  Twitter shad who want to spawn up river to get past the weir. Will find a pic for you...

tweets.text:
A major coastal protection scheme is underway in #Walmer and #Deal, including new rock groynes to help reduce beach erosion caused by longshore drift @BrehenyCivils @EnvAgencySE 
https://t.co/0xNs9ynpXJ https://t.co/xO7nzTIxmf
Ashlands Storm Overflow today in usual Yorkshire Rain @YorkshireWater @YWHelp . Also Middleton Pumping station sewage plume and lower brook street sewage plume. @EnvAgency https://t.co/eNnT9A6ad6

The @EnvAgencyYNE have completed the work at Norfolk Bridge in #Sheffield removing silt and debris from the #RiverDon.

As with other sites, silt removed down to just above water level to preserve fish spawning gravel beds while reducing flood risk.

Roughly 200tonnes removed! https://t.co/wdrXpnp1nW

@CleanIlkley @YorkshireWater @YWHelp @EnvAgency That’ll be the same @yorkshirewater that dumped 616,000 hours worth of raw sewage into Yorkshire’s rivers last year. And what did the @EnvAgency do about it? Sweet fanny adams

Earlier today, and along with our partner agencies @EnvAgency & @DurhamCouncil we have handed the site of the Old Eldon Brickworks back to the site owner. All waste has been extinguished and the site will continue to be monitored over the coming days. Thank you for your support. https://t.co/sw1bVpuR9g

@CleanIlkley @YorkshireWater @YWHelp I reported this to the EA this morning. This isn't an outlet, it's a stream, so an illegal discharge. No incident number sent to me as yet. The river this morning was simply an open sewer, pouring sewage out of every available point.

At last, a group of parliamentary supporters to champion our struggling chalk streams. Thank you @OliverHealdUK @CharlesWalkerMP @CherylGillan @libdemdaisy @DanielZeichner @gaganmohindra @Laura__Farris  
 and more... https://t.co/VTmkrWAMYZ

urls.description: ArcGIS Living Atlas of the World is the foremost collection of geographic information from around the globe. It includes maps, apps, and data layers to support your work.

tweets.text: @ProfJGrey @EnvAgencyYNE @WildTroutTrust @aireriverstrust @PeteTurnerEA @ilkleyIain @YorksWildlife @crayfish_uk @BradfordCityAA @njmilsom What was the cause of mortality?
@EdwinBeatnik @SevernUnlocked @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @severnrivers @CanalRiverTrust @NaturalEngland @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW It passes fish. 😆
#wetlands one of the world’s most important but overlooked ecosystems @WWTworldwide @EnvAgencySE @RamsarConv @RSPBPagham @mwhgpage #medmerry @chichesterharbo @CPRE https://t.co/VUqcNleFC9

Green areas do remain in the charred landscapes devastated by fires in the American West. The reason for that, according to research by @EmilyFairfax, is wetlands created by beavers. https://t.co/1OBxu2Hmfr

urls.title: How beavers became North America's best firefighter
urls.description: The rodent creates fireproof refuges for many species, suggesting wildlife managers should protect beaver habitat as the U.S. West burns.

tweets.text: Great to see so many #flood wardens & #community #volunteers on our Incident Management webinar tonight - we’re talking plans & procedures for groups, command structure, managing the media, flood plans & much more! #CPYorks @EnvAgencyYNE @SimonHildonEA @GroundworkYorks https://t.co/sYvYNuOcEK
@SevernUnlocked @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @severnrivers @CanalRiverTrust @NaturalEngland @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW What does the fish pass do?

@RiccoMason @SevernUnlocked @GarethTrewick @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup Lots of research from similar structures in France went into the designs. Aesthetics were obviously part of it as you fairly point out, though ultimately making sure it works was the most important thing. It looks quite stark now but will blend in over time

@SevernUnlocked @GarethTrewick @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup I was also surprised by this! Was the use of natural boulders considered? And has gravel been added to the bed? I feel that this could have been made to look and function far more like a natural channel, presumably with advantages for fish. Fantastic achievement nonetheless!

@GarethTrewick @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup They were originally going to be round in shape but realised a square design created better resting spaces for the fish!

We were out in #London with the @DVSAgovuk and @CityPolice checking waste vehicles had the correct paperwork. Make sure you give your waste to legit waste collector and ask for their ‘waste carriers registration’ and you can check with @envgency here https://t.co/29zfaL1G7i https://t.co/zjLjEJVdIy

tweets.text:
Really big day as first Severn water flows through brand new fish pass at Bevere #Worcestershire 

One of 4 being constructed by @SevernUnlocked @CanalRiverTrust 

When all complete next year will allow unrestricted fish passage up the Severn for 1st time in 160 years. https://t.co/fgwfIRMQ1B
